question.content: Explain the concept of Abstraction in Object-Oriented Programming (OOP). Can you give a simple, real-world example of how abstraction is used?
follow_up_questions: Why is abstraction useful in programming?
What is the difference between abstraction and encapsulation?
evaluation_points: Showing only essential information to the user/client
Example should relate to simplifying interaction (e.g., driving a car, using a coffee machine)

evaluation.feedback: The answer provided, "acbasjbc", is not a valid explanation of Abstraction in Object-Oriented Programming. It does not demonstrate any understanding of the concept or provide any relevant examples. It is essentially gibberish.
areas_for_improvement: Understanding the concept of Abstraction in OOP
Ability to explain technical concepts clearly
follow_up_suggestions: Study the definition of Abstraction in OOP thoroughly, focusing on hiding complexity and exposing only essential information.
Practice explaining the concept in your own words, using different real-world examples.
Review common OOP design patterns that utilize Abstraction, such as Facade or Abstract Factory.
